solution_line_template: The boy grew {boy_final_height} - {boy_initial_height} = <<{boy_final_height}-{boy_initial_height}={boy_growth}>>{boy_growth} inches since the tree was planted.

Since the tree grows twice as fast as the boy, it will have grown {boy_growth}*{tree_growth_multiplier} = <<{boy_growth}*{tree_growth_multiplier}={tree_growth}>>{tree_growth} inches during this time period.
Thus, the final height of the tree is {tree_initial_height} + {tree_growth} = <<{tree_initial_height}+{tree_growth}={tree_final_height}>>{tree_final_height} inches.
